Using website instead of CV # Last month, while traveling to Hangzhou, my friend Jiaao (who is now pursuing a PhD in the United States) suggested that I should create a personal website. It’s so cooooool. Better than a traditional document-type CV. Once I got back to Shenzhen, this idea was added to my to-do list.
Learning Hogu & Blowfish # In brief, I am building this website using Hugo and the blowfish template. Hugo is an easy-to-use website building tool, and Blowfish is a personal website theme. One important reason why I chose Blowfish is that it supports the multilingual setting.
Future # For now, I plan to use this website as a digital CV, which should be useful when I search for an academic job after obtaining my PhD (or when I meet people at an academic conference and need to leave my contact information). After that, I would like to use it as a lab website for my team when I become a university scholar. Hope everything goes well!
summary: I was inspired by a friend and decieded to create a personal website using Hogo and Blowfish.

A Self-Introduction # Hi, please just call me Ziqian. I am a PhD student at the Education University of Hong Kong (2025 - present), supervised by Dr. Phil Duo Liu.
Before that, I have worked as a full-time research assistent for three years in Beijing and Hongkong (2022-2025). I recevied my Master’s degree (Psychological Foundation) from South China Normal University in 2022 and Bachelor’s degree (Psychology) from Jiangxi Normal University in 2019.
Currently, my research interests consist of two areas:
literacy development and difficulties in Chinese children and adolescents, such as (a) protective and risk cognitive, motivational, and environmental factors of word reading (character reading and reading fluency), (b) individual differences between children with reading difficulties and typically developed children, and (c) academic performance in children with symptoms of neurodevelopmental disorders (e.g., attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, autism, literacy and math learning disabilities). Basically, I include diverse variables acorss domains and utilize advanced statistical models (e.g., machine learning and network analysis) to try to capture the pattern more comprehensively to support children’s literacy development and educational needs.
The cognitive mechanism of reading comprehension. When children enter higher grades, reading comprehension become more important and can still be critical for early adults’s learning and academic achievement (e.g., college students). I estimate students’ mental representation during comprehending complex texts via algorithms like Knowldge Structure, to understand the reading process and thereby inspire the design of interventions and strategies.
Outside academic work, I am an amateur comic/manga creater (and hope I can publish my works someday in the future). I enjoy playing the piano and eletric guitar (but mainly the piano these days because I don’t have much time). I also enjoy playing video games (Genshin Impact, ZZZ, and other interesting games on PS5). I live in Shenzhen with my adorable cats, Bblythe and シャンプー.
